p: Palmitic acid (common name) is categorized as saturated fatty acid with chemical formula CH 3(CH 2) 14COOH (IUPAC name: hexadecanoic acid). The main sources of palmitic acid are palm oil, olive oil, meats, cheese, cocoa butter, breast milk and dairy products [ 18]. Napalm, is a derivative of palmitic acid, synthesized by the combination of aluminium salts of palmitic acid and naphthenic acid and it was used as fuel during World War II [ 19].
